intro: Tragopogon lamottei, commonly known as the Lamotte's thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant features basal rosettes of spiny, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, forming a dense, dandelion-like inflorescence. Tragopogon lamottei is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
